p: Within the current study, albuminuria was used as a surrogate measure of renal function. This choice was based on its ease of measurement using POC technology and the fact that the urine albumin:creatinine ratio is a commonly used indicator of diabetic nephropathy [ 39]. Furthermore, a number of large meta-analyses have shown that albuminuria predicts end-stage renal disease irrespective of gender [ 40] or the presence or absence of hypertension [ 41] or diabetes [ 42].
